profileText: A Representative from Nebraska; born in Bloomington, Monroe County, Ind., on November 4, 1868; attended the common schools and Valparaiso College, Indiana; settled in Fremont, Dodge County, Nebr., in 1887; studied law; taught school; county superintendent of schools in Dodge County 1890-1894; author of books on education; engaged in agricultural pursuits, manufacturing, publishing, and banking; delegate to the Democratic National Conventions in 1904, 1908, 1920, 1924, and 1932; elected as a Democrat to the Sixty-second Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the death of James P. Latta; elected to the Sixty-third, Sixty-fourth, and Sixty-fifth Congresses and served from November 7, 1911, to March 3, 1919; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1918 to the Sixty-sixth Congress; resumed his former business pursuits; member of the State board of education of Nebraska 1923-1926; died in Fremont, Nebr., January 13, 1939, and the remains were cremated.

note.content: Elected November 7, 1911, to fill vacancy caused by death of James P.Latta, and became a member of the House on December 4, 1911.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Stephens, Dan V. Cottonwood Yarns. Illustrated by Clarence Ellsworth. Fremont, Nev.: Hammond and Stephens Company, 1935.
------. Passing of the Buffalo at The Cottonwoods. Fremont, Nev.[?]: N.p., 1938.
------, ed. Peter Stephens and Some of His Descendants, 1690-1935. Fremont, Nev.: Hammond and Stephens Company, 1936.
------, ed. Stephens Family Genealogies; Peter---Joshua---William---Alexander, 1690-1938. Rev. ed. Fremont, Nev.: Hammond and Stephens Company, 1940.

researchRecord.name: 1910-1936. 26 feet. (ca. 15,000 feet).
researchRecord.description: Correspondence relating to congressional service, clippings, mailing lists, legislative materials, printed matter, scrapbooks, and miscellany. Finding aid in repository.
